intro: Dietrichia, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a genus of flowering plants in the sunflower family. It consists of several species, most of which are native to South America. The plants are typically herbaceous, with alternate, often hairy leaves. They produce small, yellow flowers that are clustered in a head, similar to other members of the Asteraceae family. Dietrichia species are often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and grasslands.
